rComments: Best geo prof in the department. Lectures are interesting and he is open to feedback and great at answering questions. Funny guy with lots of knowledge. If you are not happy with a grade, email the TA and talk to prof,  they will talk openly with you about it. no midterm, three assignments and weekly quizzes with final exam. Take him if you can!

Eric Crighton is the absolute best professor I've had. He truly cares about his students and takes time to answer questions and talk with us. The class was truly interesting, up to date, and left me with things to think about. He also brought Miso (his dog) to class!
The workload is reasonable and graded fairly.
dr. crighton is passionate, caring, and very knowledgable about environmental studies. marking was fair and assignments made sense with course material.
Great prof overall. Fair in grading. Would take again

Professor Crighton is amazing! 100/10, he was very considerate of student's needs and actually cared about their well-being which is a rare find. I was having a very tough mental period and he gave me all the extensions I needed even on assignments that had been due long before, allowing me to get back on my feet and healthy before the course end.

Eric is wonderful. Lectures were slow at times and spent a bit too much time on certain points, but overall very interesting and engaging. Hearing him talk about his research and these topics will make you extremely passionate about public/environmental health and prevention. Honestly just a great, kind guy who I hope to have for more courses.
He is a good professor. He is friendly to all of us and he will give you some useful feedback. Powerpoint is amazing as well. He will ask you to buy a textbook but I think it is unnecessary lol.

Professor Crighton is my favourite prof! I learned so much and the classes were always engaging. I liked that the concepts learned reflected recent events/news. I like reading and I'm passionnate about the environment so I guess I found it easy. Textbook 100% mandatory because the quizzes are based on it.
brings his dog to class, loves to talk to people, related it to real life situations and make lecture fun! you have to read to get a good grade but its interesting reading

Really great prof, you can tell he really cares about the content of the course. Often brings in guest speakers. Took as an elective and loved the course so much I switched programs. The assignments (two essays and an op-ed) are not hard but they are time consuming, start them early. Brings his dog miso to class too sometimes which is awesome!

He's a great teacher, I really enjoyed his classes. However, it is a lot of work for an introductory class. Three assignments (one op-ed and two essays (6-7 pages each) ) AND midterm and final exam. Isn't easy on the grading either but reflects the amount of work you put in. You actually have to work to pass this class, not easy.
really nice
very good professor, makes you just as passionate as he is. However you need to attend class and read the textbook to get a good grade

Overall his lectures aren't too bad, and sometimes he brings his dog to class. 3 assignments, midterm, and a final, but he doesn't grade the assignments himself & the TA's are brutal markers. Textbook is huge and so is the accompanying 500 page graphic novel on climate change you have to read for one assignment. If you're ready to work, he's okay.

His assignments are easy and don't be turned off by the group project, it's an easy one. He is kind and insightful and really knows his stuff. Leads his class like a big discussion. One of the best classes I ever took.

Fantastic prof!! Made health geo super interesting and made sitting through three hour lectures bearable (I even looked forward to this class because of prof Crighton's teaching). Average number of pages to read each week, but if you want to do well in the class, study from the readings. He will ask questions on the exam. All in all, a great guy!

This course will seriously give you passion for Public Health! If you are ready to work, read, and be intrigued by this prof's knowledge, then make sure you sign up for this course! Always be sure to do the extra readings, understand the material fully, and really do your research on the projects. He is a tough marker, but really fair as well.
Easy A. Prof Crighton is very clear and helpful. Sidetracks quite a bit, but he is funny. Class is interesting

He is pretty funny, has tons of examples and interesting videos to show. Lots of reading so be prepared. Must be comfortable with science and reports. Don't recommend as an art elective, but I managed.  Two assignments, a TON of work and graded very hard. Overall nice guy, good professor,  just the courses are sometimes rough.

Course Material was very interesting. Had a lot of readings, but at least they were interesting. Didn't really give useful feedback on tests and assignment and didn't really answer questions, advertised coop so well, I joined and that was the best decision of my undergrad :). It was a large class though (about 200)
Sometime very rude. Correction skill is very poor.

Very nice prof, and quickly replied to any questions I sent him. That being said, I feel that this class would be more suited in a faculty other than arts, as a large portion of the mark rests on a scientific report. Good prof, but would not recommend as an arts elective.

An amazing professor! He is so passionate about what he teaches, and is always available to answer questions about material or assignments (and gives good, clear answers).  Assignments and tests are marked hard, but overall it is a great class and professor

I loved this class, I hated the survey assignment as I thought the explanations were not very clear and the comments on the corrected assignments were not very useful which was kind of irksome. But the course content and the readings were phenomenal :)

Such a good first year prof. I find that his classes were interesting. He tried to keep everyones interest by adding videos and additional discussions in class. Very clear in what he is trying to get across. Midterm was extreamly easy if you paid attention in class and followed along. Overall, GREAT PROF :)

He is such an awesome prof! Super nice and very helpful. Sometimes the course content can be boring to follow, but he tries hard to keep you interested with videos, guest speakers, etc. Didn't open the textbook once and still did well in the course. Exams are straight forward and he explains thouroughly the concepts that are on it. Awesome prof!

Best professor I've ever had! His lectures are so interesting. The exams for this course were fairly simple as he prepared the class perfectly. I suggest this class more than anything. Im considering changing my major because of it
Loved this course. Professor Crighton and the TA's graded fairly. Highly recommended.

Great professor, but evaluations are difficult. Will often find unique details from one class to ask you on the exam (rather than your global comprehension/analysis). Still, very interactive, interesting class, lots of support with the TA's on every assignment. STUDY STUDY STUDY. Need to remember lots of information.

I liked prof. Crighton and the course. He uses powerpoint, videos and guest speakers in his lectures. He made sure his TAs gave lots of feedback on the first assignment so we could do better on the second.  The exams were fair. The course is pretty science-y for an arts course though (I am a science student so I liked it!).

I changed my major after taking this class! he knows his stuff and I found the lectures pretty interesting, helped me out when I couldn't afford the textbook! I did have some issues but really he's one of the better teachers I have had so far at the university.Although most of the profs such here at the university  s its not saying much

He doesn't post anything online about the assignments which really sucks for when you go to write them. You have to rely solely on any notes you took of him talking and if by some chance you miss the class you're screwed. I've never heard of a teacher who tries to make students do bad on assignments instead of trying to make them do good.

This class was definitely not what I was expecting. The workload is well above average and its difficult to do well. The assignments are extremely demanding and time consuming. If you're not willing to put in the time it will be reflected in your grade. He's very smart but his class tends to be boring and he will teach until the last minute!
An excellent lecturer.

it was probably the hardest class i took in my first semester, but pretty interesting. its basically a repeat of world issues in high school. He LOVES global warming. Make sure you stay the second half of the class because thats when he shows the videos...which WILL be on the midterm and exam (worth a lot of marks!) final is ridiculously hard!!
Funny and interesting professor, i enjoyed his classes.

This guy is the reason I am studying Environmental Studies. If you go to class (and don't act like an idiot) it is easy to do well in the class. I found the first exam a little tough, but the second one a breeze. Great guy!

Very fun prof. Marking was fair though you have to earn it. Papers/Midterm/Exam were fair as well. Had the class from 7-10 at night and he understood that no one wants to be there haha. Made environmental science interesting...didn't think that was possible before.
good

Prof is a nice guy but a VERY hard marker. Expects more than should be necessary on assignments, and can easily take a condescending tone for no apparent reason. The class [Medical Geography] is pretty boring and sometimes the content seems irrelevant. If you're looking for an easy 3rd year Geography, take GEG 3320: Geography of Tourism instead LOL
Funny prof, interesting subject, good movies in class. He has a great sarcastic sense of humour! Though one complaint; the book cost 120 dollars and I could have easily passed without it.

Course took too much of a natural science perspective, when it's supposed to be a social science course. Still interesting and easy though. Prof is young and inexperienced and it shows - knowledge is often spotty, he can rarely answer student questions but will usually look things up and report back in next class.

Really good class, the prof knows his stuff. He's also pretty young so he understands that most of us don't want to be there at 830 in the morning... overall a cool guy, makes enviro an interesting class... brings some good points to the course. I recommend him.
Boring boring boring boring.  Wow!  Environmental studies could be so much more interesting and effective.  Thanks for nothing!
